channel.title: Steam and Russia
channel.description: I went to Russia to visit my family there, an also grabbed a couple of games, the Orange Box, and the Half-life Anthology. I managed to register the Orange Box there, but I got the Half-Life Anthology at the last second, and when I tried to register in America, I said that I can't "Register it in my region." If anyone knows what to do, please help.

item.title: Steam and Russia
item.dc:creator: Firebringer
item.description:
Thanks for all the help everyone, I decided to just ask my cousin to do.

Read full topic

item.title: Steam and Russia
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
Level:

Nevermind, steam doesn’t support proxies. There are ways to enable it, but kind of frowned upon.

I guess you could make a virtual machine that by default connects to a proxy, that way you aren’t modifying steam, but I’m sure there are easier ways.

Like a VPN tunnel.

Just google for a free VPN. If one doesn’t work try the next one.

Anyway I don’t recommend buying games legally in a country like Russia, my friend buys alot of games there and most of them have been downloaded illegally, cracked, badly translated and repackaged.

Read full topic

Steam usually goes around any proxy and connects directly

You need a good VPN tunnel.

item.title: Steam and Russia
item.dc:creator: Firebringer
item.description:
Mangled*:

Just contact Steam support… you might want to also try asking on Steamforums in the Half-Life section.

I tried contacting steam support, but they just said I need to contact the seller for a refund, and I can’t exactly do that. Does anyone here know how to connect to a proxy server?

Read full topic

item.title: Steam and Russia

item.description:
Very funny
I would give my account details and the CD key to someone in Russia, but I don’t really trust anyone, so should I just use steam support, or should I try to find another way?

It doesn’t work because in Soviet Russia, games REGISTERS YOU!
